question_sentence: An amusement park is a great place to have some fun as summer winds down. Where was America’s first roller coaster built?
evidence: The first roller coaster in the US opened on Coney Island in Brooklyn, New York, in 1884.

question_sentence: You could also beat the summer heat inside a cool movie theater. Which movie is considered to be the first summer blockbuster?
evidence: Released on June 20, 1975, “Jaws” went on to become the first film to gross more than $100 million at the box office.

question_sentence: If you plan on hosting a barbecue, make sure you have enough food to go around. How many hot dogs are typically eaten in the US between Memorial Day weekend and Labor Day?
evidence: Americans typically consume 7 billion hot dogs during that period. That’s more than 800 hot dogs consumed every second, the National Hot Dog and Sausage Council says.

question_sentence: Watermelon is another cookout staple. About what percentage of a watermelon is water?
evidence: The average watermelon is about 92% water. Be sure to watch this video for simple tips on how to pick the perfect watermelon.

question_sentence: Labor Day weekend is a great time to hit the beach. Which state is known as the Ocean State?
evidence: The Ocean State is the official nickname of Rhode Island. While it’s the smallest state in the US, Rhode Island boasts some 400 miles of shoreline.

question_sentence: Speaking of states, we are in the heart of state fair season. Which fair is the largest in the US?
evidence: Big Tex” welcomed nearly 2.4 million visitors to the State Fair of Texas in 2024. And although the Iowa State Fair is not the largest, it is home to the famous butter cow sculpture.

question_sentence: Many cities and towns hold parades over Labor Day weekend. Which city held the nation’s first?
evidence: America’s first Labor Day parade occurred on the morning of September 5, 1882, in New York City. Reports at the time put the total number of marchers between 10,000 and 20,000 men and women.

question_sentence: Lemonade is a classic summer drink. Which country is credited with inventing the refreshing beverage?
evidence: Most historians trace the origins of lemonade to ancient Egypt. “Kashkab,” a drink made with barley, mint, pepper and citron leaf, dates to 10th-century Egypt.

question_sentence: According to an antiquated social custom, what color clothing should you not wear after Labor Day?
evidence: Fashion experts say the “rule” of not wearing white was one of many 19th-century style customs used to distinguish the upper and middle classes. White was tied to summer vacations — a privilege only a few could afford.

question_sentence: Finally, when does summer officially end in the Northern Hemisphere?
evidence: The autumnal equinox will occur on Monday, September 22.
